title.narrative: PK Sindh Public Sector Management Reform Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Project is to strengthen public sector performance in the Province of Sindh through improved revenue generation and expenditure management.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Adequacy of Sindh Revenue Board Funding | Description :The Provincial Government shall ensure that, unless theAssociation otherwise agree in writing, the SRB shall receive an annual allocation of resources for its current and developmentexpenditures as agreed in the legal agreements. The Provincial Government shall release the allocated funds to the SRB in a timelymanner. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Appointment of Financial Reporting Officer | Description :The Provincial Government shall recruit/select andhire by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, a financial reporting officer to prepare Project-level periodicfinancial reports; review financial and non-financing reports extracted from Sindh’s financial management information systems;manage Project disbursements, and coordinate the preparation of audited financial statements. | Due Date :01-Jul-2015

Finance Agreement :Disclosure and Annual Progress Report of PFM and Tax Reforms | Description :The Provincial Governmentmaintain/ensure, throughout the period of Project implementation, the public disclosure, in the FD’s website, of the PFM ReformStrategy; the Tax Revenue Mobilization (TRM) Reform Plan, prepare comprehensive annual progress reports on the implementation ofthe PFM Reform Strategy and the TRM Reform Plan and publicly disclose such reports in the FD website. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redressal Mechanism | Description :The Provincial Government shall ensure that the FD and SRBestablish by not later than three months after the Effective Date, and maintain throughout the period of Project implementation: a)a procurement documentation and record keeping system, including a publicly accessible website; and b) a system for the handling ofprocurement complaints, both in a manner acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :07-Jan-2015

Finance Agreement :Maintenance of Project Management Unit (PMU) | Description :The Economic Reform Unit, staffed with qualified andexperienced people, will serve as the PMU and will be vested with powers, financial resources, functions and competences, to serveas the focal unit in day-to-day implementation of Project activities in procurement, financial management, monitoring & evaluation,communications & stakeholders awareness and coordination with other agencies. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Maintenance of Tax Reform Unit (TRU) | Description :The Provincial Government shall establish and maintain forthe duration of the Project, a TRU within the FD, with qualified staff, to establish linkages with national and internationalacademic institutions to promote evidence-based tax policy planning and administration. The TRU will conduct at least twenty highquality rigorous sector-based analytical reports on sales tax on pre-approved topics. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Cell Plans and Financing | Description :The Provincial Government shall causethe M&E cell of the P&DD to prepare, within six months of the Effective Date, and carry out a costed multiyear reform plan for themanagement of a dashboard for investment interventions, including ICT-based field inspections, and proactive beneficiary feedback;and ensure that the cell receives on an annual basis, adequate allocations of financial resources. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description :The Provincial Government shall establish and maintain during theduration of the project, a Project Steering Committee, headed by ACS, P&DD, in order to periodically review, identify problems andcorrective measures, provide policy guidance, and coordinate inter-departmental efforts, in the implementation of the Project. TheProject Steering Committee shall meet at least twice every fiscal Year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Sindh Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (SPPRA) Plans and Financing | Description :The ProvincialGovernment will cause SPPRA to prepare, within six (6) months of the Effective Date, and carry out a costed multiyear reform plancovering the adoption and implementation of e-procurement, the establishment of a management information system and a procurementcertification program; and ensure that SPPRA receives on an annual basis, adequate allocations of financial resources. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Sindh Revenue Board Integrity and Dispute Resolution Systems | Description :The Provincial Government shallcause the SRB to establish, within two years of the Effective Date, and maintain throughout the period of Project implementation,an integrity management system, adequate capacity for the carrying out of tax litigation, an independent tax appeal mechanismcomprised of a tax appellate tribunal and alternative dispute resolution procedures. | Due Date :07-Jan-2017

Finance Agreement :Third Party Validations | Description :For purposes of DLIs #2, #3, #7, and #8 set forth in Schedule 3 to theFA, the terms of reference for the consultants to be hired by the Provincial Government for carrying out the third partyverification, audit, validation or analysis required under the respective DLRs, shall have been discussed and agreed with theAssociation irrespective of the source of fund of such consultancies. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Departments where geo-tagging of development schemes is implemented and information published.
Improved collection of Sales Tax on Services (STS)

baseline.value: Annual report irregular, quarterly reports not published

target.value: Four quarterly reports and one annual report published.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved. Four quarterly reports and one annual report are published

baseline.value: Debt Management Systems do not exist.

target.value: a) FD conducts a debt sustainability analysis. b) Publication of the above on the FD website approved by FS.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved. Debt sustainability analysis conducted and published on FD’s website with the approval of FinanceSecretary on 26 June 2019.

title.narrative: Establishment of internal audit (DLI until Restructuring, IRI thereafter)

baseline.value: Internal audit function does not exist.

target.value: (i) Four (4) Government Departments including Finance Department have conducted internal audits and submitted internal auditreports to their PAOs. (ii) Remaining three (3) PAOs have undertaken actions in response to the forgoing internal audit reports,within a month of such report.

actual.value: All targets for have been achieved. (i) Four (4) Government Departments including Finance Department have conducted internalaudits and submitted internal audit reports to their PAOs. (ii) Remaining three (3) PAOs have undertaken actions in response tothe forgoing internal audit reports, within a month of such report

target.value: SPPRA has: (i) certified at least five hundred (500) officers of grade BPS-16 or above; and (ii) carried out a third-party reviewof the certification process.

actual.value: Targets have been achieved and surpassed. (i) 696 officers certified as of November 25th, 2020. (ii) TPV has been carried out andpreviously confirmed the achievement of the target.

title.narrative: Enhanced SRB human resources capacity for administration (DLI)

baseline.value: Staffing and training plan is under development

target.value: SRB has approved a revised staffing plan as per the recommendation of the third-party review.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved. The Board of SRB has approved the revised staffing plan as per the recommendation of thethird-party review.

title.narrative: Risk based audits of taxpayers implemented (DLI)

target.value: SRB has: (i) issued and communicated audit observations to the concerned taxpayers; (ii) finalized the audits initiated inFY2017/18; (iii) initiated assessment (by SRB Operations Wing) under the relevant provisions of the law; (iv) selected audit casesaccording to revised risk-based criteria updated according to the feedback obtained from the completed audit cases initiated inFY2017/18.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved as per TPV report

title.narrative: Approval and initial implementation of Sindh Tax Revenue Mobilization Reform Plan (DLI)

baseline.value: Tax Reform Plan approved in Feb 2014; 2012-13 STS collection is PKR 34 billion.

target.value: (i) FD has publicly disclosed the Sindh Tax Revenue Mobilization Reform Plan.(ii) SRB’s collection of STS for FY2013/14 reachedPKR 39.43 billion.

actual.value: Sindh Tax Revenue Mobilization Plan has been disclosed. FY 16-17. Target is already met.

baseline.value: Zero automated notices; Unique taxpayer identification system does not exist; No third party linkages.

target.value: SRB has issued all notices to at least 90% of non-compliant registered taxpayers in FY2018/19 through automated systems.

actual.value: As per the TPV reports, all targets have been achievedSRB has issued notices to at least 90% of non-compliant registeredtaxpayers through automated systems.

title.narrative: Quarterly developmental development plan monitoring reports prepared and published (DLI)

target.value: P&DD has: (i) prepared and published at least twelve (12) quarterly reports on implementation of development schemes for at leastfour (4) Government Departments collectively; and (ii) carried out a third-party review.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved. (i) Quarterly progress reports for six (6) departments (i.e. 17 reports in total) prepared andpublished. (ii) TPV report was conducted and confirmed the achievement the targets.

title.narrative: Departments with proactive feedback mechanisms established

target.value: Collection of community feedback for at least 10% of provincial ADP schemes costing over PKR 1 billion in at least four (4)Government Departments.

actual.value: All targets have been achieved.MEC has collected community feedback for at least 10% of provincial ADP (costing over PKR 1billion) from five (5) departments

title.narrative: Transparency in budget formulation, allocation and execution (DLI)

baseline.value: a) Budget Strategy Paper not preparedb) One quarterly report submitted to the Provincial Assembly

target.value: FD has: (i) submitted to the Cabinet the Budget Strategy Paper for FY2019/20; and (ii) submitted all four (4) budget executionreports for FY2018/19 to the Provincial Assembly and published them on FD's website.

actual.value: According to the TPV report, targets for year 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 have been achieved.

title.narrative: Transparency in budget formulation, allocation and execution (DLI)

baseline.value: a) Budget Strategy Paper not preparedb) One quarterly report submitted to the provincial assembly

target.value: FD has: (i) submitted to the Cabinet the Budget Strategy Paper for FY2019/20; and (ii) submitted all four (4) budget executionreports for FY 2018/19 to the Provincial Assembly and published them on FD’s website. Note: The indicator was upgraded to a PDOindicator during the Restructuring. There are no changes in substance.

actual.value: According to the TPV reports, targets for year 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 have been achieved.FD has: (i) submitted to the Cabinet the BudgetStrategy Paper for FY19/20; and (ii) submitted all four (4) budget execution reports for FY18/19 to the Provincial Assembly andpublished them on FD's website
